subject: Sales
title: Disney Buys Pixar
description: A fast breakdown of Disney Buys Pixar for builders.

hook.text: By 2005, Disney animation was failing. Pixar made hit after hit. Disney needed Pixar to survive.

buildup.text: Steve Jobs owned Pixar and drove a hard bargain. He insisted on $7.4 billion in Disney stock.

discovery.text: Jobs also demanded Pixar's culture stay untouched. No Disney bureaucracy, no creative meddling.

twist.text: Most acquisitions destroy the bought company. Jobs negotiated cultural protections no one had before.

climax.text: The deal made Jobs Disney's largest shareholder. Pixar's team took over Disney Animation entirely.

punchline.text: Jobs sold Pixar but ended up running Disney Animation.

quiz.question: What unique protection did Steve Jobs negotiate for Pixar?
